intro: Rhacoma standleyi, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10-30 centimeters and prefers bright, indirect light. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water, while its flowers come in a variety of colors including purple, pink, and white. Rhacoma standleyi is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
